gameElement

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameElement.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a sleeve.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(java.lang.String player1, java.lang.String player2, Mode mode, boolean option)
      The constructor of the class which initialize the attributes.
      Game(java.lang.String player1, java.lang.String player2, Mode mode, boolean option, int[][] pawnsPlayer1, int[][] pawnsPlayer2, int[] zenPawn, java.lang.String fileName)
      The second constructor of the class which is use in the case of continuation of a game that has been save.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String player1,
            java.lang.String player2,
            Mode mode,
            boolean option)
        The constructor of the class which initialize the attributes.
        Parameters:
        player1 - The name of the first player.
        player2 - The name of the second player.
        mode - The selected mode by the user.
        option - A boolean which represents the selection of the option.

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String player1,
            java.lang.String player2,
            Mode mode,
            boolean option,
            int[][] pawnsPlayer1,
            int[][] pawnsPlayer2,
            int[] zenPawn,
            java.lang.String fileName)
        The second constructor of the class which is use in the case of continuation of a game that has been save.
        Parameters:
        player1 - The name of the first player.
        player2 - The name of the second player.
        mode - The selected mode by the user.
        option - The boolean which represents the selection of the option.
        pawnsPlayer1 - The array which contains the position of the pawns of the first player.
        pawnsPlayer2 - The array which contains the position of the pawns of the second player.
        zenPawn - The position of the zen pawn.
        fileName - The name of the file.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method is the center of the sleeve, it allows to play by calling the require element at the good moment.

      • startGui

        public void startGui()
        This method allows to launch the game in graphical interface by creating the game's object to the displayMyGrid's class.

      • startGui

        public static void startGui(java.lang.String player1,
                            java.lang.String player2,
                            Mode mode,
                            boolean option,
                            int[][] pawnsPlayer1,
                            int[][] pawnsPlayer2,
                            int[] zenPawn,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
        This method allows to launch the game in graphical interface by creating the game's object to the displayMyGrid's class. This method is used in the case of a saved game in gui.
        Parameters:
        player1 - The name of the first player.
        player2 - The name of the second player.
        mode - The selected mode.
        option - The boolean which represents the option.
        pawnsPlayer1 - The position of the pawns for the first player.
        pawnsPlayer2 - The position of the pawns for the second player.
        zenPawn - The position of the zen.
        fileName - The name of the file.

      • mainGameGui

        public void mainGameGui(int oldX,
                        int oldY,
                        int newX,
                        int newY)
        This method is the main loop of the game; when the user click on a JButton in the grid. This method is launch.
        Parameters:
        oldX - The x position of the pawn.
        oldY - The y position of the pawn.
        newX - The x position of the new square for the pawn.
        newY - The y position of the new square for the pawn.

      • saveTheGame

        public void saveTheGame()
        This method allows to write in a file the current game. We put every attributes in a Arraylist and send it to a method which can write in a file. In mode HH, I put the next current player at first to respect the order of the players. But this is not possible in HA mode.

      • displayBoard

        public void displayBoard(Square[][] board)
        This method allows to print the position of each square and puts a different color for the square which has a pawn on it.
        Parameters:
        board - The board that we must print.

      • authorizeSquare

        public Square[] authorizeSquare(int oldX,
                                int oldY)
        This method finds every possibles square from an original pawn.
        Parameters:
        oldX - The x position of the pawn.
        oldY - The y position of the pawn.
        Returns:
        The list of the authorize square.

      • changeCurrent

        public void changeCurrent()
        This method changes the current player.

      • displayBoard

        public void displayBoard()
        This method prints in the console the grid with the pawn.

      • displayBoolean

        public void displayBoolean()
        This method allows to print the position of the square and put a special color the busy square.

      • move

        public void move(int newX,
                 int newY,
                 int oldX,
                 int oldY)
        This method allows to move a pawn.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new x position of the pawn.
        newY - The new y position of the pawn.
        oldX - The current x position of the pawn.
        oldY - The current y position of the pawn.

      • pawnBelongTo

        public Player pawnBelongTo(int x,
                           int y)
        This method allows to know who owns a pawn.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the pawn.
        y - The y position of the pawn.
        Returns:
        The player owner of the pawn.

      • countTheCurrentScore

        public int countTheCurrentScore()
        This method is able to count the number of pawn outside the main chain. It doesn't work if the game is not finish or is the game ended by a draw.
        Returns:
        The number of pawns outside the main chains.

      • isWinner

        public Player isWinner()
        This class find the winner of the game.
        Returns:
        The winner of the game.
